column4: can someone help me with mounting a network drive thats on a windows system i have tried the following 1) mkdir /home/bigtony/laptopdrive 2) chmod 777 /home/bigtony/laptopdrive 3) mount -t smbfs -o UID=guest,rw //192.168.1.102/documents /home/bigtony/laptopdrive  now when i go to the directory ONLY ROOT has permission to delete a file if i type rm <file> normal user permission denied but if i type sudo rm <file> it deletes it from th
e wndows share. any way to make this normal user?
here's a link that tells how to do what you want
let me know how you make out
